item.name: Runestone Bracelet
entries: This bracelet can be fused with a weapon runestone, granting the benefits of the runestone to your unarmed strikes.

item.name: Runestone Brooch
entries: This brooch can be fused with an armor runestone, granting the benefits of the runestone to a set of clothes, robes or a piece of jewelry.

item.name: +1 Juggling Runestone

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, the weapon has 5 charges and regains {@dice 1d6-1} charges daily at dawn. When you hit a creature that is your size or smaller with a melee attack using this weapon, you can expend a charge to force the creature to make a DC 16 Strength saving throw. On a fail, both you and the target are launched 15 feet vertically without provoking opportunity attacks. You can choose to have the pair of you launched diagonally, up to 10ft horizontally, you and target must move in the same direction. Neither of you fall until the end of your turn unless you choose to. Subsequent melee attacks you make with this weapon against the creature before you both fall have advantage.

item.name: +1 Bloody Runestone

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, the weapon always appears to be covered in wet blood, and cannot be cleaned of it. While attuned to the weapon, you have advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks against creatures that can see the weapon.

item.name: +1 Glimmering Runestone

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, the weapon always appears clean and freshly polished with a satisfying sheen. While attuned to the weapon, you have advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks against creatures that can see the weapon.

item.name: +1 Charming Runestone

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, the weapon constantly emits an inaudible resonance that hinders creatures abilities to determine falsehoods. While attuned to the weapon, you have advantage on Charisma (Deception) checks against creatures that can see the weapon and are not {@condition deafened}.

item.name: +1 Distracting Runestone

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, when you hit a target with this weapon or fire a piece of ammunition from this weapon you can cause the target or ammunition to produce one of the following effects until the start of your next turn.

items: The target or ammunition sheds bright light out to a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet.
The target or ammunition emits a whistling noise that can be heard up to 60ft.

item.name: +1 Glamour Runestone

entries.name: Armor Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a set of armor or a shield, turning it into a magic item, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a set of armor that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to your Armor Class, unless it is magic armor that already grants a bonus to Armor Class.

Additionally, you can use a bonus action to alter the colors, sigils and patterns of the armor or to magically clean, dry or soil the armor. As part of the same bonus action, you can all alter any nonmagical clothing you are wearing in the same way. The armor or clothing retains its shape, materials and statistics and the effect ends if you use this bonus action again or you doff it. For example, you may alter a dirty brown tabbard into pristine red and white one bearing the sigil of a particular deity or noble.

item.name: +1 Stubborn Runestone

entries.name: Armor Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a set of armor or a shield, turning it into a magic item, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a set of armor that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to your Armor Class, unless it is magic armor that already grants a bonus to Armor Class.

Additionally, the armor fills your mind with stubborn voices, warning you against manipulitive effects. While attuned, you have advantage on saving throws to avoid or remove the {@condition charmed} condition.

item.name: +1 Bolstering Runestone

entries.name: Armor Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a set of armor or a shield, turning it into a magic item, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a set of armor that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to your Armor Class, unless it is magic armor that already grants a bonus to Armor Class.

Additionally, the armor fills your mind with reassuring voices, helping you maintain your courage. While you wear the armor, you have advantage on saving throws to avoid or remove the {@condition frightened} condition.

item.name: +1 Rooting Runestone

entries.name: Armor Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a set of armor or a shield, turning it into a magic item, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a set of armor that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to your Armor Class, unless it is magic armor that already grants a bonus to Armor Class.

Additionally, when you would be moved against your will, you can use a reaction to rapidly grow roots, spikes or hooks to hold you in place. Until the start of your next turn, your speed is 0 and you cannot be moved against your will. You must be touching a solid surface capable of supporting your weight, such as the ground or a wall, to use this reaction. This effect does not prevent teleportation and ends early if the surface you are touching is destroyed or moved away from you.

item.name: +1 Energetic Runestone (Acid)

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, the weapon constantly bears a wet sheen, as if recently dipped in liquid. It also slightly stings to touch the blade or head. When you make an attack with this weapon you can change the damage type to acid, rather than the weapon's normal damage type.

Finally, this weapon has 3 charges, and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn. When you hit a creature or object with an attack using this weapon, you can expend a charge to spray additional acid onto the target. At the start of each of it's turns, the creature or object takes {@dice 1d6} acid damage. The effect lasts 1 minute, or until the target, or a creature within 5 feet of it, uses an action to clean off the remaining acid.

item.name: +1 Energetic Runestone (Bludgeoning)

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, this weapon becomes noticeably bulkier and heavier, but not so much that it impairs it's usage. it the weapon previously had sharp edges, they appear dulled. When you make an attack with this weapon you can change the damage type to bludgeoning, rather than the weapon's normal damage type.

Finally, this weapon has 3 charges, and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn. When you hit a creature or object with an attack using this weapon, and the target is composed primarily of solid, inorganic matter, such as stone, metal or crystal, you can expend a charge to deal double bludgeoning damage to the target.

item.name: +1 Energetic Runestone (Cold)

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, this weapon always appears to bear a light coating of frost and emit a thin cold mist. When you make an attack with this weapon you can change the damage type to cold, rather than the weapon's normal damage type.

Finally, this weapon has 3 charges, and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn. When you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, you can expend a charge to impose a {@dice 1d6} penalty on the target's next Dexterity check or saving throw before the end of its next turn.

item.name: +1 Energetic Runestone (Fire)

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, this weapon always appears to faintly glow as if extremely hot. it may also emit faint embers or small flames. When you make an attack with this weapon you can change the damage type to fire, rather than the weapon's normal damage type.

Finally, this weapon has 3 charges, and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn. When you hit a creature or object with an attack using this weapon, you can expend a charge to deal an additional {@dice 2d6} fire damage to the target.

item.name: +1 Energetic Runestone (Force)

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, this weapon always appears slightly transparent, as if made of magic rather than matter. When you make an attack with this weapon you can change the damage type to force, rather than the weapon's normal damage type.

Finally, this weapon has 3 charges, and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn. When you make an attack with this weapon, you can expend a charge to increase its range or reach for the attack. For a ranged attack, the long range is increased by 30 feet and attacking at long range does not impose disadvantage on the attack roll. For a melee attack the reach is increased by 5 feet.

item.name: +1 Energetic Runestone (Lightning)

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, this weapon constantly crackles and sparks with lightning. The area immediately surrounding the weapon always appears to have unusual levels of static. When you make an attack with this weapon you can change the damage type to lightning, rather than the weapon's normal damage type.

Finally, this weapon has 3 charges, and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn. When you hit a creature or object with an attack using this weapon, you can expend a charge to create an arc of lighting to an additional target of your choice within 10 feet of the original target, provided the original attack roll can hit it. The second target takes {@dice 2d6} lightning damage.

item.name: +1 Energetic Runestone (Necrotic)

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, this weapon emits a faint and ominous dark smoke. Occasionally, when it damages a creature, drinking noises can be heard. When you make an attack with this weapon you can change the damage type to necrotic, rather than the weapon's normal damage type.

Finally, this weapon has 3 charges, and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn. When you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, and that creature is not a construct or undead, you can expend a charge to gain {@dice 2d6} temporary hit points. The creature also cannot regain hit points until the end of its next turn.

item.name: +1 Energetic Runestone (Piercing)

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, this weapon has usually sharp points and edges, even if it didn't before. These points and edges appear far thinner that should physically be possible with typical weapon materials. When you make an attack with this weapon you can change the damage type to piercing, rather than the weapon's normal damage type.

Finally, this weapon has 3 charges, and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn. When you make an attack with this weapon against a creature that is wearing armor or wielding a shield, you can expend a charge to gain a +5 bonus to the attack roll. This attack roll also scores a critical hit on a roll of 19 or higher.

item.name: +1 Energetic Runestone (Poison)

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, this weapon always appears to be coated in a dark, oily liquid. This liquid is extremely bitter if tasted. When you make an attack with this weapon you can change the damage type to poison, rather than the weapon's normal damage type.

Finally, this weapon has 3 charges, and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn. When you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, you can expend a charge to force the creature to make a DC16 Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, removing the condition on a success. A creature that fails the saving throw but is immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition instead has disadvantage on its next ability or attack roll.

item.name: +1 Energetic Runestone (Psychic)

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, this weapon constantly emits faint whispers and eerie songs, often in ancient undecipherable languages. When you make an attack with this weapon you can change the damage type to psychic, rather than the weapon's normal damage type.

Finally, this weapon has 3 charges, and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn. When you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, you can expend a charge to force the creature to make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of the weapon for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, removing the condition on a success.

item.name: +1 Energetic Runestone (Radiant)

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, this weapon constantly emits a faint radiant glow. Sometimes a soothing choir can be heard from the weapon that brings comfort to non evil creatures nearby. When you make an attack with this weapon you can change the damage type to radiant, rather than the weapon's normal damage type.

Finally, this weapon has 3 charges, and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn. When you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, you can expend a charge to restore {@dice 1d8} hit points to a creature of your choice within 10 feet of the original target. Alternatively, you can choose to deal {@dice 1d8} radiant damage to an undead or fiend creature within 10 feet of the original target (this can include the target). The weapon also emits 10 feet of bright light until the start of your next turn.

item.name: +1 Energetic Runestone (Slashing)

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, this weapon gains a number of serrations and barbs on its blades, heads or points. When you make an attack with this weapon you can change the damage type to slashing, rather than the weapon's normal damage type.

Finally, this weapon has 3 charges, and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn. When you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, and that creature is not a construct or undead, you can expend a charge to give the target a debilitating wound. Until the end of its next turn, the creature takes {@dice 1d6} slashing damage for every 5 feet it moves.

item.name: +1 Energetic Runestone (Thunder)

entries.name: Weapon Runestone
entries: Over the course of an hour, this runestone can be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon, if it is not already. See the {@variantrule Runestones|J:Runestones|runestone} rules for information on how to use runestones.
While attuned to a weapon that this runestone is fused with, you have a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls made with it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to these rolls.

Additionally, noises produced by this weapon are noticeably louder and reverberate more than they naturally should. When you make an attack with this weapon you can change the damage type to thunder, rather than the weapon's normal damage type.

Finally, this weapon has 3 charges, and regains {@dice 1d4-1} charges daily at dawn. When you hit a creature or object with an attack using this weapon, you can expend a charge to push the target 15 feet away from you. If the target is Huge or larger, or is a creature that succeeds on a DC16 Strength saving throw, they are only pushed 5 feet. If this movement would force the target into the space of a creature or object that is its size or larger, both targets take {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage and the target stops moving.

variantrule.name: Runestones
entries: Runestones are magic items that can be fused with items for magic effects. They can also be removed and transfered to different items.

In some worlds, these might literally be stones or gemstones that can be physically fused with items for their benefits. In others they might be special words or sigils that can be engraved on to the item, requiring special rituals to awaken their power, but only one instance of the engraving can be awakened at once no matter how many times its copied. It could also be an incorporeal enchantment that is attached to the item and must be removed befor it can be attached to another.

entries.name: Fusing and Removing Runestones
entries: Over the course of an hour, a runestones can be fused with an appropriate item, turning it into a magic item if it is not already. This can be done during a short or long rest. Similarly, a runestone can be removed over the same duration.

The DM may decide that fusing and removing runestones is a specialist skill that requires a DC15 Intelligence (Arcana) Check to do. Or even that only specialist runesmith characters can do it, often for a fee.
Typically only one runestone can be fused to one item at a time, though some special, extremely rare items may exist that allow additional runestones.

entries.name: Armor Runestones
entries: Armor Runestones are designed to be fused with a set of armor or a shield, turning it into a magic item.
Typically, armor runestones can only be fused with sets of armor, however, items like the {@item Runestone Brooch|J:Runestones} allow gaining the benefits even when not wearing armor.

entries.name: Weapon Runestones
entries: Weapon Runestones are designed to be fused with a weapon, turning it into a magic weapon. Attacks with the weapon count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.
Typically, weapon runestones can only be fused with weapons, however, items like the {@item Runestone Bracelet|J:Runestones} allow gaining the benefits when attacking with unarmed strikes.

entries.name: Using runestones with magical items
entries: At the DM's discretion, runestones can be fused with items that are already magical. When doing so, use the following rules:

items: If the runestone grants a bonus to Armor Class and is fused with a set of armor or a shield that already grants a bonus to Armor Class, the bonuses do not stack and you choose which bonus to use.
If the runestone grants a bonus to attack and damage rolls and is fused with a weapon that already grants a bonus to these rolls, the bonuses do not stack and you choose which bonus to use.
If the runestone requires attunement and is fused with an item that also requires attunement, the item and runestone together count as one item for the purposes of attunement.

If the runestone has charges and is fused with an item that also has charges, the charges do not combine and remain separate. Charges for the runestone's effect can only be used for that effect, nor can charges from the base item be used for this effect.

entries: These rules can also apply if an item has multiple runestones fused with it.
